ground_truth: Evan gets no answer from Lenny, who stands in the exact same spot. Evan spins to face her, grabs his psychology textbook from under his seat, gets up, and turns in his exam. He flashes a confident smile, opens the window, and checks out his Psych project: a small maze with several flatworms at one end and a bowl of cornflakes at the other. Cricket puts on her Doc Martens as Evan watches the worms. Plenty of underage students carry pitchers of beer to their tables while Evan and Thumper play pool against two young women. Heidi, beautiful and wearing ripped jeans with no makeup, is there. Thumper seems oblivious to their taunts as Evan knocks the three-ball in the side. Another barrage of popcorn hits Thumper's jacket, although his hand clenches on the cue, and he meekly shuffles away to the opposite side of the pool table from the cackling Greeks. Evan and Heidi, making out, burst through the door and fall on the bed. Evan's shirt is unbuttoned, and Heidi strokes his chest, but suddenly Heidi stops and sniffs the air. Evan drunkenly crosses the room, grabs two beers from the mini-fridge, and Heidi takes one. Heidi then looks under the bed. Color drains from Evan's face as he realizes what he's reading. As Evan reads, the world seems to almost imperceptibly vibrate around him like a tuning fork. He looks around, utterly confused by his surroundings. Before an answer comes, Tommy smiles at his good fortune and swings the plank, hitting Evan's head. Evan is sent sprawling backward, his forehead bleeding freely as Tommy knocks him hard in the ribs with his boots. Evan writhes in agony, his face against the ground. Lenny moves toward the gunny sack, lifts it, and tugs desperately on the rope that traps Crockett inside. Tommy spins around and flashes an evil smile. Evan, beaten and bloody, reaches out with his last bit of strength, grabs Tommy's foot, and holds on, but Tommy yanks his leg back, breaking Evan's grip. Tommy smiles viciously at Lenny, traumatized to watch Tommy pick up the lighter fluid and spray a liquid fuse from the campfire to the soaked gunny sack. Evan comes to with Heidi slapping him awake. After getting his bearings, he grabs his jacket and exits, leaving her dumbfounded. Evan drives and, exhausted, finally pulls into Lenny's driveway. Now 20, Lenny is making a model airplane in a room filled with model airplanes. Mrs. Kagan, grayer and fatter, opens the door and escorts Evan inside. Lenny looks up to see Evan, his jaw dropping. We see Lenny's working on the model again, in his own world. Evan picks up a model airplane from the desk but is startled and drops the model on the desk.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Evan receives no reply from Lenny, who remains in the precise identical location. Evan rotates to confront her, seizes his psychology tome from beneath his chair, rises, and submits his assessment. He flashes a self-assured grin, opens the pane, and examines his Psych endeavor: a miniature labyrinth with various planarians at one extremity and a basin of cereal at the other. Cricket dons her Doc Martens as Evan observes the worms. Numerous juvenile scholars transport jugs of ale to their tables while Evan and Thumper engage in billiards against two young ladies. Heidi, stunning and clad in torn denim with no cosmetics, is present. Thumper appears oblivious to their jibes as Evan pockets the three-ball in the flank. Another volley of popcorn strikes Thumper's coat, although his hand grips the cue, and he timidly shuffles away to the opposing side of the billiard table from the chortling Greeks. Evan and Heidi, kissing, burst through the portal and collapse on the cot. Evan's shirt is unfastened, and Heidi caresses his torso, but suddenly Heidi halts and scents the atmosphere. Evan drunkenly traverses the chamber, seizes two ales from the mini-cooler, and Heidi accepts one. Heidi then peers under the cot. Color drains from Evan's visage as he comprehends what he's perusing. As Evan reads, the world appears to almost imperceptibly oscillate around him like a tuning fork. He glances around, utterly perplexed by his environment. Before a response arrives, Tommy grins at his good luck and swings the board, striking Evan's cranium. Evan is sent sprawling backward, his brow bleeding freely as Tommy strikes him firmly in the ribs with his footwear. Evan writhes in torment, his face against the ground. Lenny advances toward the burlap bag, hoists it, and tugs desperately on the cord that traps Crockett within. Tommy twirls around and flashes a sinister grin. Evan, battered and bloodied, reaches out with his last bit of vigor, grasps Tommy's foot, and holds on, but Tommy yanks his leg back, breaking Evan's hold. Tommy grins malevolently at Lenny, traumatized to observe Tommy pick up the lighter fluid and disperse a liquid fuse from the bonfire to the saturated burlap bag. Evan regains consciousness with Heidi slapping him awake. After gaining his bearings, he seizes his coat and departs, leaving her astounded. Evan drives and, fatigued, finally pulls into Lenny's driveway. Now 20, Lenny is constructing a model aircraft in a chamber filled with model aircraft. Mrs. Kagan, grayer and heavier, opens the portal and escorts Evan inside. Lenny glances up to see Evan, his jaw dropping. We see Lenny working on the model again, in his own realm. Evan picks up a model aircraft from the desk but is startled and drops the model on the desk.

A confident smile is flashed by him, and the window is opened to check out his Psych project: a small maze with several flatworms at one end and a bowl of cornflakes at the other. The room is drunkenly crossed by Evan, and two beers are grabbed from the mini-fridge, and one is taken by Heidi. She then looks under the bed. Color drains from Evan's face as he realizes what he's reading. As the text is read by Evan, the world seems to almost imperceptibly vibrate around him like a tuning fork. The surroundings utterly confuse him as he looks around. Before an answer comes, Tommy smiles at his good fortune and swings the plank, hitting Evan's head. Evan is sent sprawling backward, his forehead bleeding freely as his ribs are knocked hard by Tommy's boots. Agony is writhed in by Evan, his face against the ground. Lenny moves toward the gunny sack, and it is lifted by her, while the rope that traps Crockett inside is tugged on desperately. Tommy spins around and flashes an evil smile. Beaten and bloody, Evan reaches out with his last bit of strength, grabs Tommy's foot, and holds on, but Tommy yanks his leg back, breaking Evan's grip. Tommy smiles viciously at Lenny, traumatized to watch Tommy pick up the lighter fluid and spray a liquid fuse from the campfire to the soaked gunny sack. Evan comes to with Heidi slapping him awake. After getting his bearings, his jacket is grabbed by him, and he exits, leaving her dumbfounded. Lenny's driveway is pulled into by Evan, exhausted after driving. Now 20, Lenny makes a model airplane in a room filled with model airplanes. The door is opened by Mrs. Kagan, grayer and fatter, and Evan is escorted inside. Lenny looks up to see Evan, and his jaw drops. Lenny is working on the model again, in his own world. A model airplane is picked up from the desk by Evan but is startled, and the model is dropped on the desk.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Evan gets no response from Lenny, who stands still. Evan turns, grabs his psychology textbook, and submits his exam. He smiles, opens the window, and checks his Psych project: a maze with flatworms and cornflakes. Cricket dons her Doc Martens as Evan observes the worms. Underage students carry beer pitchers; Evan and Thumper play pool against two women. Heidi, beautiful in ripped jeans, watches. Thumper, unfazed by taunts, moves after a popcorn barrage. Evan scores, and he and Heidi burst through the door, falling on the bed. As Heidi feels Evan's chest, she smells something odd. Evan, drunk, gets two beers; Heidi searches under the bed. Evan's face pales as he reads, confused by his vibrating surroundings. Before understanding, Tommy swings a plank, hitting Evan's head, causing him to bleed and writhe in pain. Lenny tries to free Crockett from a gunny sack as Tommy grins evilly, spraying lighter fluid toward it. Evan regains consciousness with Heidi's help, leaves, and drives to Lenny's house. Lenny, now 20, builds a model airplane, surrounded by others. Mrs. Kagan, older and heavier, lets Evan in. Lenny is shocked to see him. Evan picks up a model airplane but drops it on the desk.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Evan, getting no answer from Lenny, spins to face her, grabs his psychology textbook, turns in his exam, and checks his Psych project: a maze with flatworms and cornflakes. Cricket dons Doc Martens, Evan and Thumper play pool. Thumper ignores taunts, Evan sinks a shot, and popcorn hits Thumper's jacket. Evan and Heidi make out and fall on the bed. Heidi sniffs the air, Evan drunkenly grabs beers. Evan reads, confused as the world vibrates. Tommy hits Evan, leaving him bleeding. Lenny lifts a gunny sack, freeing Crockett. Tommy sprays lighter fluid, but Evan grabs Tommy's foot; Tommy breaks free. Heidi awakens Evan, who leaves, drives to Lenny's. Now 20, Lenny builds model airplanes. Mrs. Kagan escorts Evan, startling Lenny. Evan drops a model airplane.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Evan, seeking an answer, receives none from Lenny, who remains rooted in the very same spot as before. Evan spins around to face her, reaching under his seat to retrieve his trusty psychology textbook. He stands up with determination and strides over to submit his exam confidently. With a self-assured smile adorning his face, he proceeds to open the window and take a look at his psychology project: a small, intricate maze with several flatworms positioned at one end and a bowl brimming with cornflakes waiting at the other. Meanwhile, Cricket is putting on her sturdy Doc Martens boots as Evan watches the worms slithering through the maze with interest. Around them, numerous underage students are busy carrying pitchers of beer back to their tables. In this lively atmosphere, Evan and his friend Thumper engage in a game of pool against two young women. Amidst the crowd, Heidi, stunningly beautiful and casually attired in ripped jeans with no makeup, makes her presence felt. Thumper, seemingly indifferent to the jests directed his way, focuses on the game as Evan successfully sinks the three-ball into the side pocket. As another flurry of popcorn descends onto Thumper's jacket, his hand tightens around the cue stick, prompting him to quietly shuffle away to the far side of the pool table, away from the mocking laughter of the Greeks. In a different scene, Evan and Heidi, caught up in the throes of passion, crash through the door and tumble onto the bed. Evan's shirt is undone, and Heidi tenderly strokes his chest, but suddenly, she stops and sniffs the air. With a slight sway from intoxication, Evan crosses the room and retrieves two beers from the mini-fridge, offering one to Heidi, who accepts it. Curious, Heidi peers under the bed, and a wave of color drains from Evan's face as he registers the significance of what he's reading. As Evan reads, the world around him seems to vibrate subtly, like a tuning fork resonating with energy. Confusion washes over him as he surveys his surroundings, trying to comprehend where he is. Before answers materialize, Tommy appears, smiling at his fortuitous position, and swings a plank at Evan's head. The impact sends Evan sprawling backward, blood flowing from his forehead as Tommy lands a hard kick to his ribs. Evan writhes on the ground, his face pressed against the dirt. Lenny moves towards the gunny sack, lifting it and pulling desperately on the rope that confines Crockett inside. Tommy turns around, flashing a malicious smile. Despite being beaten and bloodied, Evan summons the last remnants of his strength to reach out and grab Tommy's foot, attempting to hold on. However, Tommy brutally yanks his leg back, breaking Evan's grip. With a vicious smile, Tommy turns his attention to Lenny, who is traumatized as she watches Tommy pick up the lighter fluid and create a dangerous liquid fuse leading from the campfire to the drenched gunny sack. Evan then regains consciousness to find Heidi slapping him awake. After gathering his wits, he hurriedly grabs his jacket and leaves, leaving Heidi in utter astonishment. Exhausted, Evan drives off and eventually arrives at Lenny's driveway. Now, at the age of 20, Lenny is engrossed in making a model airplane in a room filled with numerous model airplanes. Mrs. Kagan, who is now grayer and heavier, opens the door and guides Evan inside the house. As Lenny looks up and sees Evan, his jaw drops in disbelief. We see Lenny, immersed once more in his work on the model, seemingly lost in his own world. As Evan picks up a model airplane from the desk, he is unexpectedly startled, causing the model to slip from his grasp and fall back onto the desk.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Evan, in search of an elusive answer, finds himself confronted with silence from Lenny, who remains firmly planted in the exact same spot as before, unmoving and silent. With a determined pivot, Evan turns to face her, reaching beneath his seat to pull out his well-worn psychology textbook, a source of knowledge and reliability for him. Rising from his seat with a sense of purpose, he confidently strides over to submit his exam. Wearing a self-assured smile that lights up his face, he opens the window and gazes thoughtfully at his psychology project: a small, intricate maze crafted with meticulous detail. At one end of the maze, several flatworms begin their journey, while at the opposite end, a bowl overflowing with cornflakes serves as their destination. Meanwhile, Cricket is busy lacing up her sturdy Doc Martens boots, preparing for whatever the day may bring as Evan's attention is drawn to the worms as they slither intriguingly through the maze. All around them, a bustling crowd of underage students is energetically hauling pitchers of beer back to their tables, contributing to the lively atmosphere. Amidst this backdrop, Evan and his friend Thumper find themselves immersed in an engaging game of pool, challenging two young women with playful camaraderie. Amidst the bustling crowd, Heidi stands out, her stunning beauty accentuated by her casual attire of ripped jeans and her natural, makeup-free face.

While Thumper seems undisturbed by the jests directed at him, he channels his focus into the game as Evan deftly sinks the three-ball into the side pocket. Another shower of popcorn rains down onto Thumper's jacket, prompting him to tighten his grip around the cue stick and quietly retreat to the opposite side of the pool table, distancing himself from the mocking laughter of the Greeks. In a completely different scene, the intensity between Evan and Heidi is palpable as they burst through the door, caught up in the throes of passion, and tumble onto the bed. Evan's shirt hangs open, and Heidi lovingly caresses his chest, yet suddenly halts as she sniffs the air with a curious expression. With a slight, intoxicated sway, Evan moves across the room to retrieve two beers from the mini-fridge, offering one to Heidi, who graciously accepts it. Curious and maybe a bit apprehensive, Heidi glances under the bed, and instantly, Evan's face grows pale as he absorbs the significance of what he is reading. As he reads, the very fabric of his world seems to vibrate subtly, as if resonating with the energy of a tuning fork. Confusion engulfs him as he scans his surroundings, struggling to make sense of where he might be. Before clarity dawns, Tommy unexpectedly appears, wearing a grin reflective of his advantageous position, and swings a plank forcefully at Evan's head. The blow sends Evan sprawling backward, blood streaming from his forehead as Tommy follows up with a vicious kick to his ribs. Evan writhes in pain on the ground, his face pressed into the dirt.

Meanwhile, Lenny moves towards the gunny sack, urgently attempting to free Crockett by pulling on the rope that binds him inside. Tommy turns, his expression malicious as he grins wickedly. Despite his current state of being battered and bloodied, Evan musters the last reserves of his strength to reach out and seize Tommy's foot, desperately attempting to hold tight. However, Tommy violently yanks his leg back, breaking Evan's grip with ease. With a cruel smile on his lips, Tommy shifts his attention to Lenny, who is frozen in horror as she watches him pick up the lighter fluid and create a perilous liquid fuse that leads from the campfire to the soaked gunny sack. Evan, later, regains consciousness to the sensation of Heidi slapping him awake. Gathering his wits quickly, he grabs his jacket in haste and departs, leaving Heidi utterly bewildered and taken aback. Exhausted and running on adrenaline, Evan drives off with urgency, eventually arriving at Lenny's driveway. Lenny, now at the age of 20, is deeply engrossed in the intricate task of assembling a model airplane in a room overflowing with similar creations, each a testament to his passion. Mrs. Kagan, now visibly grayer and heavier with time, opens the door and warmly ushers Evan into the house. Upon seeing Evan, Lenny's jaw drops in disbelief, unable to process the unexpected sight before him. We find Lenny once more immersed in his work on the model, seemingly lost in a world of his own making. As Evan picks up a model airplane from the cluttered desk, he is suddenly startled, causing the model to slip from his grasp and tumble back onto the desk.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Evan calls out to Lenny but receives no response, as Lenny remains stationary in the exact same spot, seemingly unresponsive. Frustrated, Evan spins around to face the opposite direction and reaches down to retrieve his psychology textbook from under his seat. With the book in hand, he rises from his chair and proceeds to walk towards the front of the classroom where he hands in his completed exam. Displaying an air of confidence, he graces his face with a smile and moves towards the window, which he proceeds to open. Peering out, he shifts his focus to examine his Psychology project—a small, intricately designed maze. At one end of the maze, several flatworms are placed, their slow movements directed towards the opposite end where a tempting bowl of cornflakes awaits them. Meanwhile, Cricket, preparing for the day, slips on her sturdy Doc Martens boots as Evan remains fixated on observing the behavior of the worms. The scene transitions to a lively bar environment where a multitude of underage students are busily and stealthily carrying pitchers of beer back to their tables, eager to indulge in the forbidden drinks. Amidst this undercurrent of youthful defiance, Evan is engaged in a competitive game of pool, teaming up with Thumper as they face off against two young women. Among the crowd, Heidi makes her entrance—stunningly beautiful, dressed in ripped jeans, and wearing no makeup, exuding a natural charm. Throughout the game, Thumper appears unperturbed by the teasing remarks from their opponents, remaining focused as Evan successfully pockets the three-ball into the side pocket. Suddenly, another wave of popcorn rains down on Thumper's jacket, prompting him to tighten his grip on his pool cue. In response, he timidly shuffles away to the opposite side of the pool table, distancing himself from the mocking Greek students. In a sudden, passionate interlude, Evan and Heidi burst through a doorway, consumed in their embrace, and collapse onto a bed together. In the heat of the moment, Evan's shirt becomes unbuttoned, while Heidi tenderly caresses his chest. However, their intimacy is abruptly interrupted when Heidi pauses and begins sniffing the air, sensing something amiss. Evan, slightly intoxicated and disoriented, stumbles across the room and opens the mini-fridge, grabbing two beers, one of which he hands to Heidi. With curiosity piqued, Heidi peers under the bed. The color drains from Evan's face as he comes to a startling realization while reading something important. As he reads, he's overtaken by an unsettling sensation, perceiving the world around him to subtly vibrate as though it were a tuning fork. Confused and bewildered, he glances around his unfamiliar surroundings, struggling to make sense of it all. Before he can find answers, Tommy, wearing a smile of sinister satisfaction, takes advantage of the moment and swings a plank at Evan's head. The impact sends Evan sprawling backward, and he feels the warmth of his own blood flowing freely from his forehead. Tommy capitalizes on Evan's vulnerability, delivering a brutal kick to his ribs with his boots, leaving Evan writhing on the ground, his face pressed against the earth in agony. Amidst the chaos, Lenny makes a desperate attempt to move towards a gunny sack, lifting it and frantically tugging on the rope that confines Crockett inside. Tommy, noticing Lenny's actions, spins around and flashes a malicious grin in her direction. Despite his battered state, Evan summons the last of his strength to reach out and grasp Tommy's foot, attempting to impede his actions. However, Tommy aggressively yanks his leg back, easily breaking free from Evan's weakened grip. Turning his attention back to Lenny, Tommy smiles viciously, savoring her horror as he picks up a can of lighter fluid. With deliberate malice, he begins to spray a continuous stream of the fluid, creating a dangerous fuse that stretches from the campfire straight to the drenched gunny sack. Amidst this harrowing scene, Evan regains consciousness with a start, awakened by Heidi's frantic slapping to rouse him. As his senses gradually return, he gathers his wits about him, hastily grabs his jacket, and exits the room, leaving a bewildered Heidi in his wake. Still reeling and exhausted from the series of traumatic events, Evan drives away and eventually pulls into Lenny's driveway. Now aged 20, Lenny is engaged in the meticulous construction of a model airplane within a room cluttered with numerous other model aircraft. Mrs. Kagan, now grayer and heavier than before, opens the door to welcome Evan and courteously escorts him inside their home. As Evan steps into the room, Lenny looks up from his work, his eyes widening and jaw dropping in astonishment at the sight of Evan. Once more, we see Lenny absorbed in his work on the model, a world unto himself. Evan, curious and slightly anxious, picks up one of the model airplanes from the desk, but in his startled state, he inadvertently drops it, the delicate structure clattering back onto the table.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Evan receives no response from Lenny, who remains motionless. He retrieves his psychology textbook, submits his exam with a confident smile, and observes his Psych project—a maze with flatworms moving toward cornflakes. Meanwhile, Cricket dons her Doc Martens as Evan watches. At a venue teeming with underage students drinking beer, Evan and Thumper engage in a pool game against two young women. Heidi, casually beautiful in ripped jeans, is present. Unfazed by taunts, Evan successfully sinks a shot while popcorn is thrown at Thumper, causing him to retreat from the mocking onlookers. Later, Evan and Heidi, in a passionate embrace, tumble onto a bed. As they begin to undress, a peculiar scent captures Heidi's attention, prompting Evan to drunkenly fetch beers from a mini-fridge. Heidi peers under the bed, and Evan's expression changes as he reads something unsettling. Everything around him vibrates subtly, and he is confused until Tommy suddenly attacks him, causing severe injuries. Lenny tries to free Crockett from a gunny sack as Tommy menacingly advances, preparing to ignite a trail of lighter fluid. Evan later regains consciousness to Heidi's frantic slaps, grabs his jacket, and leaves abruptly. Exhausted, he drives to Lenny's house. Lenny, now 20, is engrossed in assembling a model airplane in a room full of them. Mrs. Kagan, now older, welcomes Evan inside. Lenny is shocked to see Evan, but soon returns to his model-building. Evan picks up a model from the desk but accidentally drops it.

Evan spins to face her, grabs his psychology textbook from under his seat—psychology often being a popular major due to its insights into human behavior—gets up, and turns in his exam. He flashes a confident smile, opens the window, and checks out his Psych project: a small maze with several flatworms at one end and a bowl of cornflakes at the other, a classic experiment to demonstrate basic learning and memory in biology classes. Cricket puts on her Doc Martens, a popular brand of boots known for their durability and fashion status, as Evan watches the worms. Plenty of underage students carry pitchers of beer to their tables, illustrating the often lax enforcement of drinking laws at college parties, while Evan and Thumper play pool against two young women, a typical leisure activity in college towns across America. Thumper seems oblivious to their taunts as Evan knocks the three-ball in the side pocket with precision. Evan and Heidi, making out, burst through the door and fall on the bed in a passionate embrace. Evan's shirt is unbuttoned, and Heidi strokes his chest, but suddenly Heidi stops and sniffs the air, possibly sensing something amiss. Evan drunkenly crosses the room, grabs two beers from the mini-fridge, a typical fixture in college dorm rooms, and Heidi takes one. Heidi then looks under the bed, uncovering something significant. Color drains from Evan's face as he realizes what he's reading. As Evan reads, the world seems to almost imperceptibly vibrate around him like a tuning fork, resonating with an unsettling truth. He looks around, utterly confused by his surroundings, disoriented by the revelation. Before an answer comes, Tommy, an opportunistic character, smiles at his good fortune and swings the plank, hitting Evan's head with a dull thud. Evan is sent sprawling backward, his forehead bleeding freely as Tommy knocks him hard in the ribs with his boots, likely steel-toed for maximum impact. Evan writhes in agony, his face against the ground, the rough concrete pressing painfully into his skin. Evan comes to with Heidi slapping him awake, her frantic actions bringing him back to consciousness. After getting his bearings, he grabs his jacket, now stained and rumpled, and exits, leaving her dumbfounded by his abrupt departure. Evan drives and, exhausted, finally pulls into Lenny's driveway, a familiar sanctuary. Now 20, Lenny is making a model airplane in a room filled with model airplanes, a hobby that demands patience and precision. Mrs. Kagan, grayer and fatter from the passing years, opens the door and escorts Evan inside, the house filled with the comforting smell of home-cooked meals. Lenny looks up to see Evan, his jaw dropping at the sight of his friend. We see Lenny's working on the model again, in his own world, immersed in the delicate task. Evan picks up a model airplane from the desk but is startled and drops the model on the desk, the fragile parts scattering slightly.

Before an answer comes Tommy smiles at his good fortune and swings the plank hitting Evan's head. Evan is sent sprawling backward his forehead bleeding freely as Tommy knocks him hard in the ribs with his boots. Evan writhes in agony his face against the ground. Lenny moves toward the gunny sack lifts it and tugs desperately on the rope that traps Crockett inside. Tommy spins around and flashes an evil smile. Evan beaten and bloody reaches out with his last bit of strength grabs Tommy's foot and holds on but Tommy yanks his leg back breaking Evan's grip. Tommy smiles viciously at Lenny traumatized to watch Tommy pick up the lighter fluid and spray a liquid fuse from the campfire to the soaked gunny sack. Evan comes to with Heidi slapping him awake. After getting his bearings he grabs his jacket and exits leaving her dumbfounded. Evan drives and exhausted finally pulls into Lenny's driveway. Now 20. Lenny is making a model airplane in a room filled with model airplanes. Mrs Kagan grayer and fatter opens the door and escorts Evan inside. Lenny looks up to see Evan his jaw dropping. We see Lenny's working on the model again in his own world. Evan picks up a model airplane from the desk but is startled and drops the model on the desk.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Evan gets no answer from Lenny who stands in the exact same spot. Evan spins to face her grabs his psychology textbook from under his seat gets up and turns in his exam. He flashes a confident smile opens the window and checks out his Psych project. a small maze with several flatworms at one end and a bowl of cornflakes at the other. Cricket puts on her Doc Martens as Evan watches the worms. Plenty of underage students carry pitchers of beer to their tables while Evan and Thumper play pool against two young women. Heidi beautiful and wearing ripped jeans with no makeup is there. Thumper seems oblivious to their taunts as Evan knocks the threeball in the side. Another barrage of popcorn hits Thumper's jacket although his hand clenches on the cue and he meekly shuffles away to the opposite side of the pool table from the cackling Greeks. Evan and Heidi making out burst through the door and fall on the bed. Evan's shirt is unbuttoned and Heidi strokes his chest but suddenly Heidi stops and sniffs the air. Evan drunkenly crosses the room grabs two beers from the minifridge and Heidi takes one. Heidi then looks under the bed. Color drains from Evan's face as he realizes what he is reading. As Evan reads the world seems to almost imperceptibly vibrate around him like a tuning fork. He looks around utterly confused by his surroundings. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jasper gets no reply from Casey, who sits in the same precise place. Jasper twirls to face him, retrieves his geography novel from under his table, stands up, and delivers his report. He beams a triumphant grin, shuts the door, and peeks at his Art assignment: a tiny labyrinth with several crickets at one end and a cup of oats at the other. Indigo laces up her Nike sneakers as Jasper observes the crickets. Several youthful visitors transport cartons of lemonade to their chairs while Jasper and Rocket toss darts against two old gentlemen. Lola, charming and sporting a skirt with heavy jewelry, can be seen. Rocket appears unaware of their giggles as Jasper sinks the seven-pin in the corner. Another shower of feathers covers Rocket's coat, although his fist tightens on the bat, and he quietly shuffles away to the far side of the dart board from the jeering Romans. Jasper and Lola, kissing, crash through the entrance and land on the couch. Jasper's belt is undone, and Lola caresses his shoulder, but suddenly Lola halts and sniffs the breeze. Jasper clumsily crosses the space, seizes two sodas from the cupboard, and Lola accepts one. Lola then peers over the couch. Color fades from Jasper's cheeks as he grasps what he's viewing. As Jasper studies, the world appears to subtly tremble around him like a resonating bell. He glances around, completely baffled by his environment. Before a solution arrives, Frankie grins at his luck and flips the board, striking Jasper's elbow. Jasper is flung backward, his chin bleeding openly as Frankie kicks him firmly in the shins with his shoes. Jasper squirms in distress, his cheek against the floor. Casey maneuvers toward the duffle bag, raises it, and yanks urgently on the chain that binds Rocket inside. Frankie pivots and flashes a wicked grin. Jasper, battered and bloody, reaches out with his final ounce of energy, clasps Frankie's ankle, and holds tight, but Frankie jerks his leg away, shattering Jasper's grasp. Frankie grins maliciously at Casey, shocked to witness Frankie pick up the paint brush and spread a powdery line from the barbecue to the drenched duffle bag. Jasper awakes with Lola tapping him conscious. After gathering his senses, he snatches his sweater and departs, leaving her puzzled. Jasper travels and, weary, eventually stops at Casey's garage. Now 30, Casey constructs a toy car in a space filled with toy cars. Mrs. Lane, greyer and bulkier, unseals the gate and guides Jasper inside. Casey glances up to spot Jasper, his eyes widening. We observe Casey tinkering with the toy again, lost in his own universe. Jasper lifts a toy car from the counter but is startled and lets the toy fall on the counter.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Evan, unable to get a response from Lenny, turns in his exam confidently. He checks on his psychology project involving flatworms and cornflakes. Meanwhile, in a lively scene, Evan and Thumper play pool with two young women, facing taunts from onlookers. Evan later finds himself with Heidi, but their romantic moment is interrupted by an unsettling smell. More confusion ensues as Evan drunkenly fetches beers and reads something alarming, causing the world to vibrate around him. Suddenly, Tommy attacks Evan, leaving him beaten and bloody. As Lenny attempts to free Crockett from a trap, Tommy threatens with lighter fluid. Evan is eventually awakened by Heidi and leaves abruptly. He ends up at Lenny's house, where he finds Lenny making model airplanes, utterly shocked to see Evan. After picking up and dropping a model airplane, the scene underscores Lenny's immersion in his own world.
